scenarioDescription:
The HD 152581 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 152581 is a star with 1.3 times the mass of the Sun, and 5.14 times its radius. It is located 540.64 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 12 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 152581 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 152581 system


HD 152581 b

HD 152581 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2011-12, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.66 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 152581 b is 594.342 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 152581 b is 13.400 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 152581 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 152581, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 152581 - System With 1 Exoplanet
